name: Semantic Wave Equation Core Axiom
intent: Establish the existence of a semantic wave equation governing ψ-dynamics on the representation space.
constraints: There exists a representation space R (Hilbert or Banach) and an operator ψ such that ψ generates a one-parameter group U(t) \= exp(t ψ).
Semantic states r: T \-\> R obey a first-order or second-order wave equation: d/dt r(t) \= ψ(r(t)) or d²/dt² r(t) \+ L r(t) \= 0 for some semantic Laplacian L derived from adjacency.
Semantic energy E\[r\] constructed from r, ṙ, and L is well-defined and finite on a dense subset of R.
Under appropriate self-adjointness of L and absence of damping, E\[r\] is conserved along solutions of the homogeneous semantic wave equation.
